result.execSummary:
The defendant Antonio J Knox-Deal was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Escape-Criminal Arrest [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.42(3)(a).
  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Racine County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes: Defendant must pay all outstanding fees and court obligations. Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law and must pay mandatory DNA surcharge.  If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.  Do not associate with any known drug dealers or users.  Defendant may only take medication pursuant to a prescription.

No contact with K.B. (person, property, residence or family) unless approved by the agent. Comply with family court order. Engage in a cognitive thinking class. Firearm warning given. Voting prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.
No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.

timeConds.notes: STAYED. Credit for time served to be applied only if revoked.

Defendant Antonio J Knox-Deal in court with attorney Donald L. Conner.  Defendant Antonio J Knox-Deal in custody.  Antoinette L. Rich appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter:  Darlene Shue
Def- Request the bond be modified to a signature bond.
St- No objection.
BTC: Bond modification granted. $5,000 co signature bond with his mother Lori A Deal, dob 3-12-1969. Must reside at 4041 N 24th Place in Milwaukee, WI 53209. Comply with bond conditions in Milwauke county case. No drugs or alcohol with ZCI to monitor.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

**AMENDED 11/19/2015 CO SIGNATURE BOND with his mother Lori A Deal, dob 3-12-1969. Must reside at 4041 N 24th Place in Milwaukee, WI 53209. Comply with bond conditions in Milwauke county case.
